conversation.content: [exhausted] 200 puestos de trabajo. Salvé a 200 familias de... de perderlo todo. [short pause] Eso es lo que me sigo repitiendo, ¿sabes? [bitter] Como si de alguna manera las matemáticas hicieran que esté bien que tuviera que— [voice breaks] que tuviera que mirar a Marcus a los ojos y decirle que estaba fuera. [sigh] 20 años. 20 años siendo amigos y yo— [frustrated] Joder, solo su sueldo nos estaba desangrando, pero esa ni siquiera es la verdadera razón, ¿verdad? [quietly] La verdadera razón es que todo su departamento era prescindible y lo sabía desde hace meses. [regretful] Debería haberle avisado. Debería, eh, haberle dado tiempo para prepararse, pero entonces— [defensive] pero entonces la junta habría cuestionado todo y esas 200 personas... [long pause] No me coge las llamadas. [shaky voice] Su mujer me mandó un mensaje diciendo que están vendiendo el barco que solíamos coger cada verano. [laugh] ¿Te acuerdas de cuando casi lo hundimos aquella vez? [very sad] No paro de pensar en su cara cuando le dije las palabras. Simplemente... vacía. Como si ya fuera un extraño. [whispered] Quizá ahora lo soy. [pause] 200 puestos salvados. Una amistad destruida. [bitterly] Menudo especialista en reconversiones estoy hecho.

original_conversation.content: [exhausted] Two hundred jobs. I saved two hundred families from... from losing everything. [short pause] That's what I keep telling myself, you know? [bitter] Like somehow the math makes it okay that I had to— [voice breaks] that I had to look Marcus in the eye and tell him he was out. [sigh] Twenty years. Twenty years we've been friends and I— [frustrated] God, his salary alone was bleeding us dry, but that's not even the real reason, is it? [quietly] The real reason is his whole department was redundant and I knew it for months. [regretful] I should've warned him. Should've, um, given him time to prepare, but then— [defensive] but then the board would've questioned everything and those two hundred people... [long pause] He won't answer my calls. [shaky voice] His wife texted me that they're selling the boat we used to take out every summer. [laugh] Remember when we almost sank it that time? [very sad] I keep thinking about his face when I said the words. Just... blank. Like I was already a stranger. [whispered] Maybe I am now. [pause] Two hundred jobs saved. One friendship destroyed. [bitterly] Some turnaround specialist I am.
